name: easement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the legal right to cross or use someone else's land for a particular purpose: conservation easement Under the conservation easement, he will continue to own the ranch but has sold his rights to develop it. If the state doesn't purchase a permanent easement after five years, the farmer can remove his land from the program.
More examplesFewer examples The grant could also be used for acquiring protective easements along the creek. The suit claims that the developer misled the neighbours into granting an easement to dig part of a parking garage under their property. The map shows those counties in California where farmland is protected by easements.
